ab.title: Genesis 6
ab.l: And it was when men beganto multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were bornto them:
And the sons of the judges saw thedaughters of men that they were attractive. And they tookthem women, from all they chose.

And the Lord said,‘My will shall not strive with man forever,because he is also flesh; and their days shall be a hundred and twenty years seg type="commented" n="#seg001"/to cease|doing| evil deeds, and if they do not cease |doing| evil deedsuntil that time, I will not prolong my anger at them, because after thata punishment will come due to their evil deeds.’anchor type="commented" xml:id="seg001"/

Thegiants were on the earth in those times, and also after that,when the sons of judges were coming to the daughtersof men, and they were bearing children to them: they are the heroeswhich were of old: men of renown.

l.emph: evil of man was great in the earth, and all the inclination of his thoughts
of his heart was only evil, every day.

ab.l: And the Lord regrettedthat he had made man on the earth, and sufferedin his mind.

And the Lord said, ‘I will wipe out theman whom I have created from the face of the earth; from allthe men to animal to creeping thing, and to the birdsof the skies, because I regret that I made them.’

l.emph: Noah found favour in the eyes of the Lord.

ab.l: These are the generations of Noah:Noah was a just man and perfect in his own generations,and Noah walked before God.
And Noah begatthreesons: Shem, and Ham, and Japheth.
The earth was broken before God, and the earth was filledwith wickedness.
And God saw the earth,and, lo, it was broken, for all flesh had corrupted their own way on the earth.
And God said to Noah, ‘The endof all flesh has come before me, for the earth is filled with wickednessthrough them, and, lo, I will wipe them out from the earth.
Make yourself a ship of pine wood, make nestson the ship, and grease it inside and outside with pitch.
And these are the measures |according to| which you shall make it: Three hundred cubits |shall be| the lengthof the ship, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and thirty cubitsits height.
Make a window for the ship, and finish it within a cubitabove, and set the door of the ship in its side.Set storeys: make it a second storey and third storey.
And, lo, I will bring a flood of waterson the earth to destroy all flesh in which is the breath of lifeunder the skies. And everything that is in the earth shall die.
But I will strengthen my covenant with you, andand you shall come to the ship, you, and your sons, and your wife,and your sons’ wives with you.
And of every living thing, of all flesh,you shall you bring two of every one of them to the ship to keep them alive with you.They shall be male and female:
Of the birdsaccording to their kinds, and of the livestock according to their kinds, of all creeping animals of the earthaccording to its kind, two of every sort will come to you to keep them alive.
And take with you of all food that is eaten, andyou shall gather it to you, and it shall be for you and for them for food.’
And Noah did everything as God commanded him,he did so.

app.note: Inserted by another hand in South-Western Karaim.
Possibly a scribal error (or a mistranslation) instead of the correct huǯralar ‘rooms’, cf. Heb. קִנִּים ‘rooms’ (Gen 6:7).
